image.altText: A young girl in a hospital bed, surrounded by her parents and brother.

props.synopsis: Stephanie and Ian Campbell were "naive" about the impacts of influenza B until their daughter was fighting for her life. They have a message to those who haven't got their kids vaccinated.

title.children: Parents told to say goodbye to their daughter after missing one influenza vaccine

image.altText: A young woman wearing a hijab holding a malnourished young boy.

props.synopsis: A UN agency says it is trying to get more than 6,000 truckloads of aid to Gaza to alleviate mass starvation, as the US announces it is pulling out of ceasefire talks and sending its delegation home.

title.children: UN says 6,000 aid trucks cannot enter Gaza as ceasefire talks stall

image.altText: Donald Trump holds onto Elon Musk's hand with both of his own hands.

props.synopsis: It comes a month after the US president and the world's richest man publicly clashed over a controversial tax and spending bill.

title.children: Trump says he wants Musk to 'thrive' as Epstein scrutiny continues

image.altText: A man wearing a bandana ripping off a t-shirt to show another t-shirt bearing Donald Trump's name.

props.synopsis: Hogan is widely credited with transforming America's wrestling scene into a family entertainment spectacle, but courted controversy in his later years as his private life overtook his public persona.

title.children: Hulk Hogan, wrestling superstar and Trump supporter, dies at 71

image.altText: A family of four stand in a building allotment.

props.synopsis: A Facebook group with only five members criticising developer Kinslake could be enough for this family to lose thousands of dollars.

title.children: Family could lose $45,000 of home deposit over social media post

image.altText: A Tibetan man shows a framed portrait of the 11th Panchen Lama, Gedhun Choekyi Nyima.

props.synopsis: China's communist authorities forcibly disappeared the boy chosen to play a major role in the succession of the Dalai Lama, and 30 years on, Tibetan Buddhists continue to resist their attempt to take control.

title.children: Person who would pick next Dalai Lama has been missing for 30 years

image.altText: An older man with a moustache, wearing a suit, smiling.

props.synopsis: Former star of the screen and stage Henri Szeps has died after a battle with Alzheimer's disease.

title.children: 'Died as he lived': Australian actor Henri Szeps dies aged 81

image.altText: Adam Spilstead giving evidence at ICAC

props.synopsis: A traffic controller has told the state's corruption commission he would go as far as using his pokie winnings to bribe a Transport for NSW official.

title.children: Traffic controller went behind 'wife's back' to pay kickbacks

image.altText: People sheltering with their belongings in a concrete bunker.

props.synopsis: Border tension between Thailand and Cambodia has escalated into an armed clash that has killed more than 10 civilians and left many others fleeing for safety.

title.children: Why is there conflict between Thailand and Cambodia?

image.altText: a man in an orange jumpsuit sits at a desk in a courthouse

props.synopsis: Bryan Kohberger's co-workers, cellmates and former Tinder matches have labelled him "socially awkward" and "annoying" in newly released police documents.

title.children: New documents detail 'socially awkward', 'annoying' Idaho killer

image.altText: A woman with a serious expression on her face.

props.synopsis: Danielle Bensky was waiting for the bathroom at a New York nightclub when a woman asked if she'd be interested in massaging her client — a wealthy financier named Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: As more Epstein survivors speak out, the American people feel 'played' by Trump

image.altText: Sussan Ley ABC

props.synopsis: The opposition leader faces a diabolical situation with the debate over whether the Coalition should abandon the 2050 net zero target.

title.children: Why are political parties still bickering over net zero?

image.altText: TS dancers

props.synopsis: Both Torres Strait Islander peoples and Pacific Islanders have taken their climate battles to the courtroom in recent weeks. Together, they send a message to the world of what stands to be lost if leaders don’t take serious action on climate change. Will Australia heed the warning?

title.children: Climate ruling puts Australia on notice, but is Canberra listening?

image.altText: A woman carrying two dogs walks away from damaged buildings billowing smoke

props.synopsis: A displaced Ukrainian family has died and two Russian women have been killed as Moscow and Kyiv exchanged drone strikes just hours after brief ceasefire talks in Istanbul.

title.children: Ukraine and Russia exchange drone strikes hours after failed ceasefire talks

image.altText: Psychologist holds a teenage girl's hands while balancing a clipboard on her lap.

props.synopsis: Patients and health experts say psychological screening prior to bariatric surgery may help identify people with eating disorders, and counter potential mental health impacts of the life-changing procedure.

title.children: Weight-loss surgery patients may be 'vulnerable' to eating disorders

image.altText: Accused graffiti artist Jack Gibson-Burrell enters court wearing a Spiderman mask, flanked by his lawyer

props.synopsis: The alleged creator of the Pam the Bird graffiti tag is facing dozens of additional charges, and has grabbed attention by exiting court sporting a Spider-Man costume.

title.children: Alleged 'Pam the Bird' creator dons Spider-Man costume,  faces 208 charges

image.altText: A composite photo featuring US president Donald Trump and a cooked piece of steak.

props.synopsis: Australia lifts its biosecurity restrictions on US beef imports, one of the Trump administration's key trade grievances, but the industry does not believe it will change much for consumers.

title.children: Cattle industry says shoppers unlikely to see US beef imports on shelves

image.altText: David Littleproud stands behind Kevin Hogan at a press conference

props.synopsis: After repeatedly arguing it wouldn't trade away biosecurity standards to assuage Trump, the government now argues it is satisfied with improvements in US cattle traceability.

title.children: 'To appease Donald Trump': Australia's beef backflip all-too convenient

image.altText: plane crash Amur region

props.synopsis: The burning fuselage of the plane was spotted on the ground by a helicopter after air traffic controllers lost contact on Thursday, local time.

title.children: Over 40 people feared dead following passenger plane crash in Russia

image.altText: Max Verstappen in the pit lane, looking on, while wearing a cap

props.synopsis: The three-week break between the British Grand Prix at the start of July to this weekend's race in Belgium has been one of the more chaotic periods in Formula 1's recent history.

title.children: Verstappen rumours intensify, Red Bull's new era and Piastri resumes title fight

image.altText: A white-underside humpback whale tail is visible above the surface

props.synopsis: Two whales have been spotted swimming up the Yarra River and under the West Gate Bridge, in what experts describe as a "rare" occurrence.

title.children: 'Quite a mystery' as whales spotted frolicking in Port Phillip Bay

image.altText: Jordan Dawson holds his arms out to his side with another man placing a hand on his head and shoulder

props.synopsis: Adelaide has soared into premiership contention as one of the in-form teams late in the AFL season. Winning seven of their last eight games, the Crows are perfectly placed for a September charge.

title.children: Adelaide signals its arrival as a genuine AFL premiership contender

image.altText: A Fremantle AFL player punches a West Coast player during a melee between the two sides during a game.

props.synopsis: To mark this weekend's series of interstate rivalry games, we look back at the best of the AFL era — from the Demolition Derby to a Swans-GWS elimination final.

title.children: The best of AFL Showdowns, Western Derbies, Q-Clashes and Sydney Derbies

image.altText: Ali France and Albanese

props.synopsis: From the return of federal parliament to a fresh debate on the "spirit of cricket", it's been a big week in news. Test your knowledge.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Federal parliament returns, the 'spirit of cricket' and a top dog

image.altText: A flock of sheep amid a cloud of dust in an outback paddock.

props.synopsis: A cold front moving across Queensland is expected to bring a mixed bag of weather for the Sunshine State.

title.children: Unseasonal rain, damaging winds ahead for parts of Queensland

image.altText: A red Bendigo Bank sign.

props.synopsis: Bendigo Bank announces it will be shutting down its agency model that allowed customers to access banking services from smaller locations such as newsagencies, citing "decreasing customer use" as a factor.

title.children: Bendigo Bank to close 28 agency locations due to decreasing use

image.altText: columbia uni

props.synopsis: Columbia University says it will pay the Trump administration over $330 million to restore federal research money that was cancelled in the name of combating antisemitism on campus.

title.children: Columbia agrees to pay $332m settlement to restore US federal funding

image.altText: Souni near Limassol

props.synopsis: Firefighters in Cyprus are battling for a second day to control a massive wildfire which has engulfed mountain villages in the eastern Mediterranean island.

title.children: Two die in Cyprus wildfire as 44C heat forecast

image.altText: a woman in a blue hazmat suit installing concete blocks on a seawall, with the harbour bridge behind.

props.synopsis: A year-long experiment in Sydney's iconic harbour found algae and barnacles were more likely to grow on the seawall's colourful concrete panels versus the grey panels.

title.children: How Sydney Harbour's colourful seawalls could revive marine life

image.altText: A Qatar Airways Airbus A350-900 on the tarmac on a lightly cloudy day.

props.synopsis: Five women who were subjected to strip searches at Doha airport in 2020 have won the right to pursue legal action against Qatar Airways and the airport operator.

title.children: Partial victory for women subjected to internal strip searches in Qatar

image.altText: The side of a sketch of Donna Nelson's head.

props.synopsis: Tokyo's High Court has rejected expert evidence lawyers hoped would overturn drug trafficking charges against Perth grandmother Donna Nelson.

title.children: Tokyo court rejects key evidence in jailed Perth grandmother's appeal bid

image.altText: A motorbike with medical details parked on street in front of brick building.

props.synopsis: A Queensland parliamentary inquiry into the challenges facing the volunteering sector is due to report in September.

title.children: Medical couriers provide new model as volunteering numbers plummet

image.altText: A composite image of four fair-skinned men, three of whom are in military uniform.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors have cited a lack of evidence behind a decision not to charge defence over the 2023 Taipan helicopter crash which claimed the lives of four men.

title.children: 'Defeated and broken': No charges to be laid over fatal helicopter crash

image.altText: A huge tree lies across a road in a suburban area

props.synopsis: Residents say a freak tornado that ripped through Perth's coastal suburbs sounded "like a jet engine" as it fell trees and tore up the roofs of homes.

title.children: Freak tornado 'like a jet engine' damages homes in Perth
